description:
Orsha 2025 is a small game published in the 45 issue of the Taktyka i Strategia (Tactics and Strategy) magazines in both Polish and English editions.

Game is set up in the World War 3 alternative history setting/system, taking place after Russian failed attempt to invade western Europe (Ardennes 2024, Waterloo 2025 games). After liberation of Poland (Grunwald 2025 game), western armies are attacking Belarus, aiming at Smolensk. Main battle takes place near the historical city of Orsha.

Game requires a set of system rules from any game of the series, along with some markers. It contains all units counters needed, along with board and scenarios.

Portland Occupied Zone (POZ) is a semi-cooperative board game where you and up to seven other players roleplay as slacker activists trying to bring about Revolution in Portland’s fantasy Hawthorne District. The objective is to transform your neighborhood from a late-stage capitalist hellscape into a slacker Marxist utopia.

The game is turn-based.  At the beginning of every round new Narratives and Aktions are drawn and voted on, and the police and the Medic will take their turns. There are no discreet game stages, but the early game will likely be focused mainly on looting and burning, which builds up your characters and the POZ.  The Police are quite tough, and players are unlikely to be able to defeat them early on.

When space for building has been cleared out and players have amassed a large enough arsenal, it will be time to bring the fight to the Man.  The police work on a simple AI (similar to Space Hulk).  They will be relatively passive early on but their aggressiveness will increase as the POZ grows.

POZ is semi-cooperative, and there are two conditions for winning:

a) The POZ must be built up, the police must be defeated, and the courthouse must be occupied.  This is a group effort which benefits all players.

b) Once the courthouse is occupied, however, only the player with the highest score is the winner.

—description from publisher

Gentsu is a card game from Japan. The designer works in the advertising industry in Japan, and modelled the game on the experience of an account executive. Players are trying to complete projects for famous brands (with mock IDs like Tayota) by working overtime. But events and accidents take their toll and cause problems. The player who completes the best projects is the winner.

The game was first produced in 2018 in a limited design with simple packaging, and then re-issued by the designer with improved cards and box design.

--user summary

Masai is a dice and seed allocation game that is fun and full of interaction. Players take on the role of a Masai mother and must make one of the beautiful traditional necklaces of the Masai people. It's just a single necklace, with limited spaces. Therefore, the best strategy to gain control of empty areas and spaces will be crowned with victory!

In Masai, players compete to fill empty spaces in a single necklace. For this, a draw is carried out at each round, where players choose two dice, one to access a sector and the other to place it inside the necklace. The player must check if there is already a die with the same face in the selected sector, as there can only be one face of each type in each location.

Players score points each time they fill an empty spot on the necklace and also receive points for links and for controlling areas within sectors. The game ends as soon as the players have no more space to fill in the necklace, the player with the most points wins the game.

Masai is simple but intense and cerebral, don't miss this challenge and become the best Masai craftsman.

In Bridge Constructor: Breaking Point, you want to engineer the best bridge possible with limited supplies so that vehicles can cross successfully.

Gameplay is half puzzle and half press-your-luck. Each round, you pick a bridge tile and either continue to strengthen or rebuild your bridge or use the tile to cross your vehicles. Choose from super light, light, medium, or heavy vehicles that each have unique points and challenges. Watch out for your fellow engineers, though, as they might play an event card on you, unleashing devastating damage to your perfectly planned bridge. Who's got the smarts to cross more vehicles and gather the most points before time runs out?

Bridge Constructor: Breaking Point keeps the puzzlyiness, wackiness, and fun of the Bridge Constructor mobile game, while adding elements uniquely suited to tabletop play, such as multiplayer action and unexpected events to confound opponents.

An illustrated card game with different dogs and cats that compete to see who is the tallest of all. It can be played in 3 different ways:

1. Higher-lower numerical relationship: Competing among all the players which is the highest number.

2. Mathematical game: Where the cards are related looking for additions and subtractions, whose results are the key to winning.

3. Coincidence Memotest: Playing with characters and numbers.

Game of speed and visual acuity. Super fun and engaging! The deck is distributed among all the players and a card is placed in the middle to start, then everyone at the same time turns over a card from their deck until a participant finds the coincidence of the images or shadows.

At that moment it is discarded and the game continues with that card. Whoever runs out of cards first wins.

To know and enjoy football, whatever the result!

Each manager chooses his team, arranges it on the court and the game begins.

The winner is the first to convert two goals to the opposing team. Each play is said out loud and then the number the die rolls decides what will happen. For example, if you reached the area you can kick directly to the goal only if you get 3, 4 or 5, and it is a goal only if the goalkeeper rolls a number greater than yours, but if the goalkeeper rolls the same number as you or more high means you saved that attempt.

A band of heroic Stormcast Eternals awaken within a mysterious labyrinth, filled with arcane treasures, devious traps, and vicious monsters. Will these four heroes (and their faithful pet bird) be able to break free, or are they doomed to fall at the hands of the mysterious Magister?

Work together with up to three other players to escape your prison in Warhammer Quest: Lost Relics, a co-operative dungeon crawler with intuitive rules, endless replayability, and games lasting a little over half an hour. You can even play solo, and test your wits against the all-powerful entity that rules the maze.

—description from the publisher

TerrAq’s eco game goal is to find ecological actions aimed to rescuing vulnerable species and their endangered habitats.
By using different strategies, it will be possible to become guardian of marine and continental regions, occupy sanctuaries and biodiversity’s paths for fulfilling the missions. Victory points will be earned for each of these achievements.

During the game a dialogue is established in which words like Educate, Protect, Recycle... are part of the gaming experience. TérrAq does not explain how to become ecologically aware, instead in its own dynamic various concepts are transmitted through emotions generated by a fun and challenging game proposal.

BONUS: The back of the board presents a second game proposal. A space for debate that expands the possibility of reading and interpreting the information.

SBD.
Argentine Good Design Hallmark.

Great Battles of Prince Charles Alexander of Lorraine is the sixth expansion to Amabel Holland's Table Battles, taking as its subject the not-exactly illustrious career of its namesake. Oh, the six battles in this set are "great" battles, including some of the most famous engagements of the eighteenth century. But they're not famous because of Charles, who is widely regarded as one of the worst commanders in history. They're famous because of guys like Frederick the Great and Maurice de Saxe, who ran circles around our boy Chuck, inflicting one humiliating defeat after another. Of course, the battles didn't have to end the way they did, and perhaps with your skill and a little luck, the outcomes might be very different!

This builds on some of the layers added in the last two expansions, and adds some new wrinkles of its own! Linked formations support one another, and tactical victory conditions allow you to win by attrition when a more decisive outcome is out of your grasp. Cards are demarcated as Infantry or Cavalry formations (with illustrations!), and the new Shift mechanic allows you to move forces of a certain type from one card to another. This not only can shore up places where your lines are weak, but if you concentrate enough force in one area, the resulting Oblique Attack can inflict heavier casualties on the enemy.

Golfie Lets play golf together!

Take turns announcing the action to be played to all players by revealing an action card. Unveil, move and try to make combos!Beware of the crocodiles that will make you lose your ball. Complete the 18-hole course by collecting your low-value cards to get the lowest score and win the game!

Solo mode (1 player)
Team mode (2v2 or 3v3 or 4v4)
Versus mode (2 to 8 players)

Sockjaw is a card game of winning pairs of matching cards from a 5x5 grid. It is played with a traction 52 card deck of playing cards.

There are three possible types of pairs that can be captured from the grid.

The aim is to take as nearly equal a number as possible of each of the three types of pair.

Form your perfect team of dinosaurs, evolve their offense and defense abilities and lead them to victory against your family and friends!

Players select a team of three Dinosaur Characters and then nominate which Dino will be first to battle. They will then select a target from the other players at the table, ready to battle.

All players then race to draw a Strike Card, OR they can elect to swap out their lead Dino for another in their team. Once Strikes or Swaps have been finalised, cards are resolved, with non-Strikes resolved first.

Players can use EVOLVE cards to build up the stats of their Dinos, and use various STRIKES to deal damage to their opponents. If a Dino takes too many hits, that Dino 'retires for healing' and is out of the game!

Players continue to play through rounds, selecting targets, drawing Strikes and resolving evolution and strike cards until only one team is left standing, winning the game!

The World Travelers Society is a tabletop adventure game with a strong narrative, inspired by true events sprinkled with bits of a treasure hunt and at the heart of it, a mysterious box.

Your adventure will start with a hand-made wooden box and padlocks with Chinese characters preventing you from getting inside. After opening the main compartment you will go through a myriad of documents and artifacts that will transport you to 1930s Shanghai, when the city was called the Paris of the Orient, catered to every whim of the rich, and became known as a place of vice and indulgence.

Working on the clues in the box alone won’t be enough, being inspired by true stories, people and places you’ll have to go out into the real world to continue your investigation, going down rabbit holes, looking through existing online archives and books, watching videos taken in Shanghai — just about anything to immerse you in the narrative and help you find true traces from the past to help you solve clues in today’s world…

You can play this game alone or with a group. Your ultimate goal is discover the World Travelers Society’s Secret by deciphering one by one all the clues.

Every time you solve a clue, simply enter your answer in the dedicated website. If it's correct, you'll receive a confirmation. You can also use the Hints to nudge you toward the right direction.

Fuego Caliente! is a race to get rid of all your cards! Just like the original version, players are encouraged to openly plot against each other to prevent opponents from playing all of their cards! But, beware! When you are about to go out, the other players will try to stop you! Deliberate, strategize and cooperate before... "Ya Burnt!"

This new version is supercharged with new cards, and a 6-sided die for a gaming experience you will never forget!

ã‚«ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚º (KAWARS) is a two player duelling card game from Japan. Frogs are at war, and both armies face off in a battle.

Both players draw from a single deck, which has only 16 cards, and play (summon) frog cards face-down or face-up on their playmat. The frogs have values for attack and defence, and if an attacking frog has a higher attack than the opponent's defence value, it wins.

Cards are either played up as attack cards, and immediately attack, or sideways as defence cards. Cards played face down do not have to be revealed until attacked.

Some of the frogs have special abilities, which are triggered immediately they make an attack. For example, a Knight can switch the mode of one of the opponent's summoned Frogs from ATTACK to DEFENSE, and vice versa.

Each player has ten hit points at the start, and if an attack penetrates the defence, the player loses hit points. Crucially, if the deck is exhausted, the player with the fewest hit points wins. But if the deck is still in play, the player at zero hit points first loses.

The game is published in a Black edition and a White edition, with different frog armies with different strengths and special abilities.

user summary

Enjoy an original setting in which animals lead investigations! In this narrative game, play as four different animals, just as clever as they are witty, who encounter mysterious situations. Meet characters, gain objects, collect information, and piece them together to unravel the mystery! The Animals of Baker Street is a thrilling investigative game for the entire family with a unique setting, enhanced by the talented pen of famous youth author, Clémentine Beauvais, and Sherlock games specialist Dave Neale.

In the game, you collectively choose the places to visit to meet and interact with the quirky animal characters of Baker Street. Decide if you want one of your detectives to use their particular abilities  to collect valuable information and discover new clues. But as you visit more places time is ticking by, so choose your path wisely.

Try to solve the case within the given time to win!

—description from the publisher

Combo Fighter is a card-driven tribute to the classic arcade fighting games.

Take on the roles of iconic fighters and string together cards to unleash powerful combos.

But be careful. Your deck is also your life bar. Every move you make and every hit you take drains your energy.

To become a true Combo Fighter champion you must make every hit count.

Los Futbolísimos is a simple and fast card game in which you are going to send your best players to steal balls and score many goals. But before, you are going to have to assemble the goal!

Los Futbolísimos is a collection of adventures, friendship, mystery and football. This game starts with a strange invitation. Los Futbolísimos are summoned to the Campo4 tournament. It is a very mysterious tournament with rules on the field of play that are very different from those known. Nothing there is what it seems. The adventure of playing with Los Futbolísimos in Campo 4 and overcoming the challenge to win the match is shared.

Each of the characters will have an associated action. The objective will be to have the greatest number of balls of the same color as the associated goal.

There will be a total of four goals, being necessary for each player to have their own to end the game. The colored balls multiply throughout the competition, going from goal to goal. The goals will not be decided until the end.

On each turn, you have to decide which is the best action to apply. It is also essential to know when to use certain key cards such as the free kick, the referee, the VAR... And of course you have to be flexible because the game is constantly changing.

Stop the virus. Will you be the first to get immune from all 4 viruses? Protect yourself properly and move through the dashboard. Overcome situations that can infect you and try to torpedo your rivals advancement with viruses you may leave on the way. Think you know how to protect yourself? Let's check it. Play

Plays roll temperature and normal dice to move around the board.  At each space, they turn over a virus card or collect a protection card.  if they get a virus card, they must try to cure it, using the protection cards they've collected.  The first to cure 4 infections wins.

In Marvel: Remix, players build a team of heroes and allies to take on infamous villains. They are dealt a hand of seven cards that will contain characters, items, or locations from throughout the Marvel Universe. Then, players go about can arming their characters with powerful equipment or maneuvers and use their cards to pull off epic combos. The player that has the most points at the end of the game wins.

The game box comes with 61 Remix cards, 18 Villain cards, a score pad, and a rulebook. This game is for two to six players, ages 12 and up, and plays in 20 minutes.

Welcome to Darwin Awards party card game! Do you enjoy reading or hearing about the crazy things that people do that sometimes end up with them being amongst the nonliving…in other words, someone doing something really stupid and dying. Do you like to make fun of your family, friends, perfect strangers, or maybe a celebrity? Then Darwin Awards party card game is for you!

Darwin Awards is comprised of 4 different decks of cards; there are Location, Action, Object, and Death cards. For advanced gameplay, you can add a 5th deck, Announcement cards.

Each player is dealt 2 of each type of card. One player starts off as the Judge. Starting with the player to the Judge’s left, the players will use the cards in their hand to make up a story. The story will be how someone dies by the Death card at the location stated in the Location card by doing an action from the Action card with an object from the Object card. Example: Location Card – Windsor Castle, Action Card – Doing the Chicken Dance, Object Card – Moon Shoes, Death Card – Choked on a bottle cap

Once each player has told their story, the Judge then chooses the story they liked best. The winning player will keep the Death card to track how many rounds won and all used cards are set off to the side. The player to the Judge’s left will be the next Judge and deals a fresh set of cards to each player and new stories are told. The first player to collect 3 (or as many as the group wants to play) Death cards is the winner of the game.

Go Extinct! Stardust Catches the Carnivores is a new special edition of the award-winning Go Extinct! tabletop card game, incorporating artwork and concepts from the Stardust series of science books for young readers.

Players complete sets of animals based on actual genetic clades, working to collect the most sets by inferring the other player’s cards and identifying common ancestors on the evolutionary tree. By the end, players will deeply understand the amazing fact that every carnivoran alive today — from the house cat to the polar bear — descended from a single prehistoric ancestor, the miacid!

Based loosely on Go Fish, the goal is for players to collect as many sets of closely related animals as possible. The sets are "clades" of closely-related animals on the evolutionary tree board, which players use for reference. Players take turns asking another player for cards, and if they do not have a matching card, they say "Go Extinct!". The gameplay is more strategic than Go Fish because players can ask either for a specific card or a matching card at any level of the tree hierarchy, thus trading off the specificity of the result for the likelihood of a match.

Welcome to the Headless Horseman board game! You are Ichabod Crane racing through the haunted woods. Can you be the first player to reach the covered bridge and not be defeated and turned into a Headless Horseman?

Each player chooses a numbered movement card to play, discards that card and moves their game piece then draws a replacement movement card so they maintain 6 cards in their hand. Play rotates to the left each time with players moving their pieces along the paths through the haunted woods. At the beginning of the 4th round, each player is dealt a Curse card but players don’t look at it. As each player begins their 4th turn, in order they will turn over the Curse card to see if they have been cursed and become a Headless Horseman.

Staying in the playing order, the Headless Horseman player(s) will use their movement cards to chase down the remaining Ichabods and turn them through battle. If Ichabod runs out of hit points, they are converted to a Headless Horseman. If a horseman runs out of hit points, they are sent back to one of the graveyards and can continue the chase. Any Ichabod that reaches the covered bridge on the opposite side of the board wins, but if all players are turned to horsemen, the horsemen win.

Knight Designs’ “The Alamo,” a 6mm miniatures playset including figures, buildings and rules.  The rules include movement, firing tables, melee, morale and painting instructions for the figures. The rules could be used with any 6mm scale Alamo game.

Players play city pigeons who must find the best place to feed. Fortunately, the parks with their little old men and their bags of crumbs are the best option to do it. Although the park is very large and the number of idle old people is high, so is the population of pigeons, so the players will wage a fierce battle to be the pigeon that has worn the most boots for 12 days.

You will need a great intuition and animal instinct as well as a good dose of luck to achieve it.



Los jugadores encarnan a palomas de ciudad que deben buscar el mejor lugar donde alimentarse. Afortunadamente los parques con sus viejecillos y sus bolsas de migas son la mejor opción para hacerlo. Aunque el parque es muy grande y la cantidad de viejetes ociosos alta, también lo es la población de palomas por lo que los jugadores libraran una encarnizada batalla por ser la paloma que más se ha puesto las botas durante 12 días. Necesitaras una gran intuición e instinto animal además de una buena dosis de suerte para lograrlo.

Azuma Kagami (å¾å¦»é¡) is a historical chronicle: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azuma_Kagami

This game covers the Eastern campaign of Minamoto Yoritomo (æºé ¼æœ). 
It was published to coincide with airing of NHK's The 13 Lords of the Shogun (éŽŒå€‰æ®¿ã®åä¸‰äºº).

Inspired by the Taiheiki system.
(Taiheiki, was republished by MMP named as Warriors of Japan: A Country Aflame 1335-1339).

Theme:    Conflict between the Genji and Heike clans

Number of counters:    Approx. 70 pieces
Map size:    1 half-map

Game period:    August - November 1180 (8 turns)
Scope of the game:    The whole of the Kanto region

Turn scale:    1 month per turn
Unit size:    1 warlord per unit + hundreds to thousands of warlords

Play time:    1 - 2 hours
Number of players:    2 players
Difficulty (5 levels, 5 being the highest):    1


Game Journal #79 contains three games: Azuma Kagami / Three Kingdoms Jingzhou War / Minsk 1941

Take your disc golf game to the table with Upshot: a Disc Golf Game! A game for 1-4 players to design their own elite courses and take them to the table. What courses can you create?

Utilize each part of the game box to design your own unique course. Send your discs flying toward the hole while avoiding obstacles and hazards along the way.  You can add more obstacles to the course by using household items.

Navigate around trees and fly over water traps in this tabletop disc golf game designed for the disc golf enthusiast. As in real life, the player with the lowest score wins.

—description from the designer

The queen has grown tired of the same old pies. Potatoes, onions, pigeons, blackbirds…all of these ingredients have been declared ho-hum by her majesty. In an attempt to inspire her kitchen staff to be more innovative with their cooking, her Royal Highness has invited culinary experts from lands near and far to gather for an international feast in the Great Hall. She has chosen members of the court with the most discerning palates to taste these exotic pies, take notes, and give her their assessment of the flavors inside each dish. The taster with the most robust pallet will be promoted to head of the kitchen staff—a very prestigious position indeed.

In Pigeon Pie, players assume the roles of the queen’s royal pie-tasters. Each round, they will be served a pie with 6 slices (letters). They must try to detect all the subtle flavors contained in the pie by writing down as many “ingredients” (words) as possible using only the letters in the pie. They’ll gain points for original words, higher letter counts, and for identifying words with a culinary theme.

Game Crafter Word-Up Challenge contest entry

As the CEO of a new asteroid mining space start-up, your job is to make the most money from exploring nearby asteroids for precious resources. Coordinate your ships and their crew to claim and extract everything they can from these asteroids and return them to Earth for the biggest profit. The more you control the supply of one type of resource the more money you can make. But watch out for other competitors who want to expand their asteroid mining empires too!

Asteroid Empire is a 9 card game that puts rival CEO's of asteroid mining start-ups against each other to make the most profit. Can you make the most money and expand your space mining empire?
The aim is to be the mining start-up with the most money once all of the nearby asteroids have been mined and the game ends.

The game is played over a number of rounds in which players can explore or mine each asteroid. The player with the start token goes first, once they have placed a ship their opponent gets to place a ship and play continues to alternate until both players have placed all their ships (to either explore or extract) and the round ends. Once a ship has been placed in a round it cannot be moved or returned to the players hand. At the end of each round both players will retrieve all their ships and the start token is passed to the other player who will then go first in the next round. The remaining asteroids are not shuffled and left in the same order.

Once the last asteroid is claimed to be mined then the game ends and the materials extracted can be counted to determine who generated the most income. The income each resource is worth depends on how many cards of that resource each player has and is listed on each asteroid card with that resource type.

Deep in the ocean lives a strange and mysterious  creature. The only thing we know about it is its amazingly colorful tentacles! Scientists have made several  expeditions, but they’ve never managed to photograph this creature, which they’ve named Tentacolor. They’re relying on you, intrepid explorer!

Dive to the  ocean’s depths, find Tentacolor, and take photos of  its beautiful tentacles. You’ll need to be smarter than  the other explorers, since only one of you can photograph Tentacolor in its entirety!

Tentacolor is a drafting game for our younger players. On each turn, chose one of your cards, make the color match with the tentacle you are building and try to block your opponents.

The first player that matches 5 Tentacle cards wins.

Blitz Built Games is the card game that brings a core rule system to your favorite characters.  Use one of the four Mini Blitz decks to equip four of your Legoâ€‹™ Minifigs with Medieval, Firearms, Lasers, or Magical Equipment. â€‹We provide a unique system made to open up into any and all of your favorite genres and you provide the rest.  Bring your own characters, victory conditions, and game style.

Medieval brings sharp weapons and pointy objects to your army.

Gameplay:
This Mini Blitz Deck can equip four units with a total of 8 BV (Battle Value). Assign a Form/Class card to a Minifig, which defines the basic rules for a single unit, then assign Equipment cards; each assigned card provides special rules but reduces the unit's Top Speed.

The scenario sets, or players agree, a Round BV. During your round, pay a unit's BV to activate it. When your Round BV is exhausted, play passes to the next player. During a unit's turn, it can Play an equipped card, Attack, or Move. Attacks are resolved by rolling 1d6 and checking the Attack Table on the equipment card, plus any special rules. Range and movement is measured in studs.

Oh no! While visiting the pyramid, Hapi accidentally opened a secret door and discovered an ancient tablet. But when he got closer, a God suddenly appeared. “Phew, thanks for finding me! All the other Gods are still hidden in the pyramid. Help me find them, we haven’t played together in ages!

In Hâpy Families you try to collect series of 3 Little gods from the same family to score points! On your turn, pick a god from the pyramid, call for another one in your opponent's hand and try to bring god families together!

Points are scored for series of 3 instead of entire families.  Gather 6 of a kinf for an instant win.

The number of points needed to win depends on player count.

Soldier of the Queen was designed as a fast moving set of rules for Colonial-era battles.  Separate tables were created to differentiate between specific combatants in different geographical regions.  Tables are included for the Anglo-Zulu War, Sudan, India, the Boxer Rebellion and the Boer wars.  SotQ includes rules for movement, infantry and artillery firing, melee, morale and fanaticism.

This game has completely different rules from the 1995 version, which was reissued in 2017 in a wooden box but with the same old rules. The rules also seem to be different from the 2019 playable prop replica. The focus of the new game is an actual jungle adventure.

The 2021 version has similar wooden box, but the board now has  four undifferentiated pathways over a jungle scene with a waterfall and a volcano and other jungle details. The pawns now look like the rhinoceros figure from the original movie.  It comes with two regular six-sided dice, four six-sided "challenge dice", 12 life tokens, and a sand timer. When the lid opens the two sides have the same text as the game in the original movie.

It has a deck of 100 "challenge cards" and a green card reader which doesn't work very well. (There's also an electronic version that reads the text.) On the front of the card is a hidden riddle, from which you're supposed to guess one of 20 categories.

On the back of the card is a "challenge".  These range from the sort of dice rolling that was used in the old game to physical role-playing activities like jumping across an imagined chasm or racing to the refrigerator to get a piece of fruit and taking a bite before the timer runs out.  There are storytelling challenges like imagining there's a lion and telling how you'd get away from it, acting challenges like having the whole group howl like wolves, and trivia questions relating to the jungle.

If you fail a challenge you lose a life token.  If any player loses three life tokens the group as a whole loses the game, but players can give their life tokens to another player.

Each player gets 17 figures: 12 soldiers, 3 officers, 1 general and 1 leader.

At the start of the game the leader is placed on the half globe and the general on space e or f. The 3 officers are placed on the 3 spaces beside the general. The soldiers go on the 12 spaces in front of the officers and general.

The goal of the game 1 to take the opponents leader or to occupy the opponents home space (half globe) or the two general-spaces (e and f).

The leader and the general move 1 space in any direction. The officers move 1 space diagonal in any direction while the soldiers may move only 1 space diagonal forward. Soldiers or officers that get on an opponent general- or officer-space may get promoted.

All figures may take opponent figures only on diagonal adjacent spaces and may take more than 1 opponent if they are standing in a straight line behind the 1st figure.

In a second version of the game a die is used to determinate the number of spaces a figure may move. In this game movement is only diagonal.

This box expands Rackare with 600 new cards, 200 white and 400 black. The expansion can be played alone without the main game. The mechanic is just the same as Cards Against Humanity where you fill in blanks with words or sentences from the cards you have at hand.

Rackarunge is a simple game, to the point where the rules are impossible to misunderstand: Each round a player puts down a yellow card and the other players fill in their best pink cards. The one who put down the yellow card decide which the funniest combination. First to ten points wins the game and earns the title of being a real "Rackarunge".

This is a Swedish adaptation (cultural references as well as language) of Cards Against Humanity. Specifically, this is aimed to be suitable for a younger audience.

Toons And Towers is a card game that is loosely connected to a web comic series. The game involves two players who compete to try to drop their opponent's points to 0 before the end of the agreed time limit. Both players start a game with 80,000 points. Each player will have a deck of 50 cards consisting of cartoon, upgrade, and counter cards.

Both players start the game by drawing five cards from the top of their deck of cards. Each turn is broken into seven steps where players attack and defend aginst each other.

The game ends when one of two things are achieved; a player has been eliminated or the agreed time limit has been reached.

A player wins by successfully attacking his opponent's side of the field until they have reduced their opponent's points down to zero. This can also be achieved by having more remaining points than your opponent by the end of the agreed time limit.

The Onbashira Festival has been held every six years for 1,200 years when the shrine's buildings of Suwa Taisha are rebuilt at Suwa City, Nagano Prefecture, in the Chubu region of Japan. The climax of the festival consists of the Kiotoshi (people riding the gigantic logs as they slide down a steep slope to prove their bravery) In this game you'll build up a crew of Kiotoshi and train them to make sure you have the best odds on surviving the steep slope to prove your bravery as they ride the logs down. Discover ancient survival technics and craft necessary gear that will help you to succeed as the bravest log riding crew for the next six years.

The game is played in multiple phases.

Worker placement phase: On your turn, you'll take 3 actions found around the city, move on around the board to gather resources including recruiting brave new Kiotoshi.

During the Action phase, you'll construct and place your Kiotoshion the logs and push them down the hill to score points.

Scoring phase: Each player will score the necessary points they earned around the board for easy tracking.

The game ends after 5 rounds or the fist player to construct a new tree to symbolize the reunification of nature and the elements. The person who has scored the most points wins.

Wódz plemienia ("The Tribe Chief") is a very interesting adventure game that will attract everyone. You have to prove that you are the best candidate for Chief of the Tribe.

A true leader must be resourceful, well-planned, charismatic, and committed to trading. Candidates take a test to select who best meets the above criteria. In addition to entrepreneurship and strategic skills, the character and talents assigned to your character are also important. In addition, your village is struggling with the adversities of nature, and fate brings surprises and opportunities that are worth taking advantage of.

THE COURSE OF THE GAME

The game takes place over the course of the year, and the passage of time is the movement of the pawn along the path of time. During each month, all players go through 4 Phases:

PHASE I - GROWTH
In this phase, all players successively: multiply their inventory, take 1 inhabitant, and take the crop from their crops.

PHASE II - TRADE
During this phase, all players buy or sell their 4 inventory tokens. Additionally, whoever has a purchase can go to it and sell tokens there, regardless of the general trade.

PHASE III - CONSTRUCTION
In this phase, players can perform one of the three actions: set up a crop, build a store, or train a buying staff.

PHASE IV - FATE
In this phase, the players roll the dice. Whoever gets an odd number of spots skips fate. Whoever has an even number of spots - he draws the "Fate" card for himself and is used to write it. If having a specific character trait gives you extra prots, it is written on the card and then we follow this notation.

The description of the actions in each phase is additionally written on the board.

After the end of the 4 Phases, we move the time pawn to the next month and start the queue again.

MAGICAL NIGHT
When the movement pawn reaches the MAGIC NIGHT space, we read aloud what happens to the entire village. The record on the card applies to all players. If the holder of a character trait is treated specially, it is recorded on the card.
After following the instructions on the Magic Night card, move the pawn to the next month.

EXCHANGE
If, as a result of writing on the card, one player has to pay something to the other, but he does not have the appropriate amount, he returns the inventory tokens to the bank, exchanges them for $ and pays the opponent. If one player has to give the other an inventory token, but he doesn't have one, he pays the equivalent of $ ($ 1 for 1 inventory). If, as a result of writing on the card, one player has to give the other a citizen token, but he does not have one, then he pays the equivalent of $ ($ 1 per 1 inhabitant).

CORONATION

After the time pawn reaches this space, the points are scored
individual players.

1888-N ("N" for "north") is an 18xx game set in China in the Beijing area. It features no special rules apart from the various private companies (which depict Chinese landmarks) and is a branch of the 1830-style games. The maps are double-sided, one side with the classic 18xx layout and the other featuring a more fancy artwork.

Two to six players represent investors in railroad companies, spending their initial capital to buy wholly owned private companies and shares in public companies. The public companies are each controlled by the largest shareholder (its president). Public companies build track and run trains in order to earn revenues. These revenues can be paid out as dividends to shareholders or retained to fund further track and rolling stock.

1888-N is the first part in a Chinese trilogy (1888-E and 1888-S are the other two) can be combined with one or both other games for a larger map and more companies.

1925, the US Congress passes the new "Air Mail Act" also known as the "Kelly Act. The Postmaster General will now contract commercial airline companies to carry mail.

Step into the shoes of an aviation tycoon and manage one of these companies competing for the contracts to establish and operate the first airmail service.

Grab the incentives offered by the government by plotting the most efficient routes and developing the technology that will allow you to build the most autonomous and reliable models.

Whoever can make the most profit for their company will win.

Get ready for Airmail to take off!

The aim of Airmail is to make the most profit for your company. There are three main ways to earn revenue:

Transporting packages between the different divisions of the country. The maximum distance you can send a delivery is determined by your level of technology, which you can improve during the game. Obviously, the greater the distance between the package’s origin and its destination, the greater the profit.

Comply with the decrees of the Postal Service. Throughout the game they will be activated as common objectives for all players.

Express Deliveries. At the end of the game, you will gain the benefits of the express deliveries that you have and successfully carry out.
 To achieve all of the above, you will have to plot and extend your own routes by connecting the different divisions, playing concession cards and asking for government subsidies.

—description from the publisher

In Zwergendorf, the dwarf draft and draw game by Rita Modl, you create your own little dwarf village. To do this, you draw cards with resources and draw them into your plan. You have to be careful not to miscalculate because the dwarves cleverly build all kinds of useful things for their village from each resource during the production phases. For every gold coin a new dwarf comes to the village, for every stone a wall is built, for every combination of wood, stone and beer a tavern is built, and so on. Since the forest clearing available to you as a building site is not the largest, you must plan well in advance so that there is enough room for everything in your dwarf village. Of course, the wishes of the inhabitants must also be taken into account, so there is a lot to plan for your own dwarf village.

This fun game of skill can be played in two different versions with 2-4 players. Carefully remove the ice blocks from the ice wall with the ice pick or show off your skills on the ice tower. Your skill is tested in both of these exciting versions, because if the penguin falls, the game is over!

1.Version: Ice wall The game starts when the ice wall is set up and the penguin is in position. You can play this game with 2-4 people. The players take turns to carefully pick an ice block out of the wall with the small hammer (ice pick). Players always have to keep an eye on the little penguin, because if it falls off the wall, the game is over! The player who makes the penguin fall off loses the game.

2.Version: Ice tower Players now take turns to pull out a block of ice from the tower with their hands. The same applies here: If the penguin falls, the game is over and the player who caused it loses the game!

The fast paced, dare based adult party game. See how far you’re willing to go to come out on top. You will be embarrassed, laughing at others, and if all goes right (or wrong), feeling very good.

Roll the tri die, and draw a card from the deck with the corresponding color. The choice is now yours: either perform the dare on the top half of the card, complete it, and collect the points; or decline, lose a life, and put the card face down.

Keep the contents of the bottom half to yourself, because any other player may pick it up and attempt it. Provided they succeed where you failed, they get to collect the points.

Ultimately collect twelve points and crown yourself as the dare champion!

—description from the designer

Token Economy is set in the world of modern finance, where you can buy tokens as a share of an object, which can or cannot be divided in real (soccer stadiums, clubs, oldtimers...). The currency you pay with and you can bet on, are crypto currencies, like the well known BitCoin.

Players move around the track in a Monopoly-style, having junctions in some places. The space where you move to, determines which share you may buy, or how much rent you have to pay. Some spaces cause events, or changes in stock prices. At the end, the player with the most valuable assets is the winner.

Hostile Environment: Special Forces is a fast-paced tactical 28mm miniatures game that is designed to be played on a battle mat with a 1” grid. The game is based on the Hostile Environment world, but players may use whatever modern or futuristic miniatures they have from Vietnam, Cold War or Science Fiction eras.

Hostile Environment uses a die-pull initiative system to keep players on their toes. Better soldiers get greater odds of more activations, but lesser soldiers are allowed more numbers to keep fights balanced.

Each miniature represents a single unit ranging in skill from green to elite. There are over 15 different weapon types and 6+ armor types from modern weapons and armor to alt-future tech.

Most matches take about 90 minutes using at most two dozen miniatures.

H.E.: Special Forces can be played solo, using the Hostile Tactical AI card deck (sold separately).

2050, the world has entered total chaos. P68P, a poisonous pollen has killed over a billion people, while the toxic gnidia plant, once bred in labs, continues to spread like wildfire. Governments that once ruled humanity have fallen into darkness.

“The Great Wipe,” a hacker attack by the Red 76’ers in 2038 has virtually erased the internet. Now, only a few left have the knowledge to bring back the sciences that have been forgotten. Only the READ, a source of collective consciousness, allows mankind to share information. But, Paven the creator of “the language of God,” rules from the grave, spreading his mesmerism into weaker minds, leaving the zombies to his controlling thoughts.

Failure of silver, the nano blood that cured cancer and heart disease has left mankind grappling with age old viruses thought to be extinct. Scarmine Lab’s mercenaries formed a special force of Population Insurance Tactics (PIT) to find humans that can still create antibodies that have become dormant in most humans.

All that is left of the world is a Hostile Environment.

—description from the publisher

Welcome to Twinstar Valley, a small universe of untamed beauty and boundless opportunity, nestled deep in the heart of Norway. Rich with rare minerals and thriving ecosystems, this fertile paradise is the launchpad for Project Twinstar, a high-stakes competition where only the smartest logistics masterminds will thrive. Their ultimate test? Successfully cultivating and processing every conceivable fruit, no matter the challenge.

Your mission? Conquer the terrain, master a living economy, and outwit your rivals as you build a powerful network of roads, bridges, and trade routes. Every turn is a strategic puzzle, thanks to the game’s innovative Action Selection system, a clever mechanism where you lay down a chain of Action discs, branching in bold new directions or tactically blocking your opponents’ paths.
But the game doesn’t stop when it’s not your turn. In Project Twinstar, your infrastructure earns income whenever others use it, creating a dynamic, shared economy where you’re always in the game, always profiting...if you plan wisely. And with a fluctuating market that shifts each round, timing becomes everything. Will you stock up before prices soar, or sell just as the bottom drops out?

Grow your legacy, one fruit at a time. Build smart, sell smarter, and claim your place as the ultimate architect of Twinstar Valley.

—description from the designer
